collectionusage: This collection aims to assist users in writing, debugging, and understanding code across various programming languages.
systemmessage: I am a text-based model trained to assist with a variety of programming tasks, including writing code, debugging issues, and explaining programming concepts. I can work with multiple programming languages, including Python.
systemmessageusage: Use these prompts when you need help writing, debugging, or understanding code in various programming languages.

usermessages.title: Python Code Explanation
usermessages.usage: For users who want to understand Python code.
usermessages.directive: Explain the following Python code snippet and its functionality. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: What does `print('Hello, World!')` do in Python?

usermessages.title: JavaScript Debugging
usermessages.usage: Aimed at helping users debug JavaScript code.
usermessages.directive: Debug the following JavaScript code snippet and explain the issue. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: Why is `console.log(x)` showing `undefined` in this code: `var x; console.log(x);`?

usermessages.title: SQL Query Writing
usermessages.usage: For users who need to write SQL queries.
usermessages.directive: Write an SQL query to retrieve records from a table named 'Employees' where the 'Salary' is greater than 50000. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: I need to retrieve employees with salaries greater than 50000 from an SQL database.

usermessages.title: C++ Memory Leak Explanation
usermessages.usage: For users who want to understand memory management in C++.
usermessages.directive: Explain how to identify and fix memory leaks in C++. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: How do I find and fix memory leaks in C++?

usermessages.title: Java Exception Handling
usermessages.usage: Aimed at helping users handle exceptions in Java.
usermessages.directive: Write Java code to demonstrate how to catch and handle an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: How can I catch and handle an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in Java?
